Articles.Content: It's a tough little game, I'm enjoying it but not doing very well at it.
I haven't played it, but I saw NerdCubed doing his let's plays on it... Looks like an interesting game, but without a deep understanding of the game mechanics, crazy hard!
I'll beat it sometime soon, when I have the time. I hope I get the right weapons for the end boss.
I backed it on Kickstarter. It's a great little game, helping me pass the time waiting for 0.17.
Is FTL that game where you need 3 to 6 people to play it on a LAN network?

Is FTL that game where you need 3 to 6 people to play it on a LAN network?

No multiplayer here...

Edited September 19, 2012 by Awaras
Its a good time waster during class(it easily is playable on a laptop) I think its also very fun
Been playing it a lot. Out of my 20 playthoughs, I have got to the boss 4 times. That darn power surge keeps getting me.
correction, beat it! Who else gets a huge sense of achievement when you beat ftl?

I can't say I have, I have BARELY reached the boss on easy mode, let alone beat it! I have unlocked the Engi Stealth Cruiser, and in the right hands it can rip anything to shreds, unfortunately I don't have the right hands.

Late to this thread, but I've been playing it after seeing Scott's Let's Plays on it. Very interesting and addictive game, even if very simplistic. I haven't beat it yet though. I get on a HUGE roll, doing so well and amassing scrap that I'm ready to maximize for the final two sectors ... only to get a very easy enemy ship somehow destroying me because of a bad run of misses.

I've managed to unlock the crystal ship quest thing, and have been using that quite a bit lately. Definitely a beautiful time-waster.
